metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6761 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The update_dimensions function in libavcodec/vp8.c in FFmpeg through 2.8.1, as used in Google Chrome before 46.0.2490.71 and other products, relies on a coefficient-partition count during multi-threaded operation, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (race condition and memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted WebM file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6761` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
No subscription required

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavformat57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavresample3 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavutil55 - 7:2.8.3-1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswresample2 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswscale4 - 7:2.8.3-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> as of 2018-09-27, no equivalent fix in libav.

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218').
ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.3-1').
